column4: Why does'nt anyone know the answer to this??? How do I resolve in breezy these xsession errors "** (gnome-session:8178): WARNING **: Host name lookup failure on localhost." or "_IceTransTransNoListen: unable to find transport: tcp"  ???????/
Is this a bug in BReezy??
what program is that in?
it appears in my .xsession on a "new breezy" install right after I log in
so...you can not log in?
if I can msg you, I will give you the entire xsession
yes I can log in, but I just want to know why....and is everyone else getting this
just to make clear, this causes you no problem?
I am guess is not...but how can I be sure..I am new to linux...and I just want to know what errors mean
I do not use BP and I only use default repos for apps...
it means what it says. dunno what it would mean to the system. If it causes nno problems, likely there is a logical explanation for it.
I guess my question then is...do the majority of breezy users (that will check) can multiple instances of _IceTrans.....bla bla in the their ~/.xsession-errors????
I dont answer polls, maybe someone else will.
yes. https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RestrictedFormats
not you.
how do I find out for you?
a good question would have been, run "blah" tell me whether you see line "blah", if you are so willing to learn about this new gnu/linux...
well the problem is...that this exist on a "fresh newly installed, log in one time" breezy installation, without running anything. I have indeed tested that.
well, tell me the command to find out, already:)
I have a running ubuntu.
oh just open your .xsession-errors (located in your home dir) * its hidden too :)
